reviews.title: beautiful hotel on a paradise Island

reviews.text: The only MAJOR bad thing about the hotel and the one thing that has put us off going to any other country like Mauritius is that on the final day our flight left at 09:00 which meant getting up at 04:30 for the taxi to the hotel an hour away. When the Taxi turned up a member of the hotels staff ask me to tell him to wait while we checked out, while i was round the front the porter made a strong sexual advance on my girlfriend, luckily i walked round the corner in time, he told her to be quiet but she told me instantly. i confronted him and we left the hotel immediatley even though he refused to take our hotel keys. Hopefully he hasn't done this before and wont again. We didnt have anytime to tell anyone there hence the review. The experience left us very upset. SO PLEASE BEWARE.

likes.disliked: — I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It was great, i highly recoment it if you visit Mauritius.

reviews.text: Check in was relatively easy and were given a drink and were shown to our room which was massive. It was on the top floor and had a huge (very comfortable) bed, balcony and bathroom with whirlpool corner bath for two. We were amazed given the price. There was also a plasma tv and had placed flowers in the room. If did have a slightly unfinished feel though.
reviews.title: Amateur Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was OK as it was just with sand with loungers on it and not strictly a beach going into the sea, more like rocks. There was also a nice pool and jacuzzi in the hotel, they also served drinks to the loungers and had a scuba diving centre. There was a normal beach next door to the hotel though which was public and had more watersports available, guys selling coconuts to drink from and cocktails etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday in a stunning location
